abstract: Why did they cook the books at G.E.?
snippet: Why did they cook the books at G.E.?
lead_paragraph: My Friday column goes over the Enronesque nature of some parts of General Electric’s $50 million settlement with the S.E.C. It also points to the memoir of James Martin, who, armed with a fresh degree from Wharton, joined G.E.’s financial training program more than a quarter-century ago. He reports being promptly told to rig numbers so that they would meet expectations.
